item.title: Alexander 1 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Alexander: Gordias - The Fist of the Father (Savage),” the first encounter of the entire Alexander raid series. |

item.title: Alexander 10 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Alexander: The Creator - The Breath of the Creator (Savage),” the tenth encounter of the entire Alexander raid series. |

item.description: | noun | 1. “Alexander: Midas - The Cuff of the Son (Savage),” the sixth encounter of the entire Alexander raid series. |

item.description: | noun | 1. “Alexander: Midas - The Arm of the Son (Savage),” the seventh encounter of the entire Alexander raid series. |

item.title: Alexander 9 Savage

item.title: Animation Lock
item.description: Animation lock refers to the amount of time your character is locked in animation from casting an action, skill, ability, etc., preventing you from doing any other action. Animation lock on instant actions tends to be around 0.6-0.7s (ping and latency variable). For casted skills the animation lock is about (0.1+2/fps) seconds (also known as caster tax). For the duration of the lock your character is frozen and cannot cast another action.

item.title: AoE
item.description: Area of Effect

item.title: Coil
item.description: | noun | 1. The level 50 Coils of Bahamut raid series. The encounters in each of the raid tiers were named “Turn 1, Turn 2, " etc., so they are abbreviated as T1-T13. The first tier was The Binding Coil of Bahamut (BCoB). The second tier was The Second Coil of Bahamut (SCoB), and the final tier was The Final Coil of Bahamut (FCoB). Note: the official names started with 1 for each tier, as in “The Second Coil of Bahamut, Turn 1,” but the western community simply continued to count upward from where the previous tier left off, and that trend caught on, which is how we got the convention for abbreviating all the 8-man raids since then.

item.title: Critical Direct Hit
item.description: | noun | 1. When one attack simultaneously scores both a critical hit and a direct hit, denoted by the flying text being larger and the damage number having three exclamation marks at the end. May also be called a “direct crit.” |

item.title: Critical Hit
item.description: | noun | 1. A secondary stat/substat that modifies your critical strike chance and critical damage multiplier. |

item.title: Crystal Tower
item.description: | noun | 1. The level 50, 24-man alliance raid series, including Labyrinth of the Ancients, Syrcus Tower, and The World of Darkness. Extremely relevant to the main story. |

item.title: Determination
item.description: | noun | 1. A secondary stat/substat that simply modifies your damage dealt and healing done by a small percentage. |

item.title: Dexterity
item.description: | noun | 1. The primary attribute, or “main stat,” that is used by physical ranged DPS and Ninja. |

item.title: Direct Hit
item.description: | noun | 1. The DPS “role substat” that gives you a chance to score “direct hits,” which multiply the damage of an attack by 1.25, like a mini-critical hit. Only damaging abilities can score direct hits. Though the tank and healer role substats have no effect on other roles, the DPS “role substat” does function on tanks and healers. Tank and healer gear simply never has direct hit on it natively, so the only way to get it as a tank or healer is by melding direct hit materia.

item.title: Eden 1 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Gate: Resurrection (Savage),” the first encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 10 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Promise: Litany (Savage),” the tenth encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 11 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Promise: Anamorphosis (Savage),” the eleventh encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 12 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Promise: Eternity (Savage),” the twelfth encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 2 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Gate: Descent (Savage),” the second encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 3 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Gate: Inundation (Savage),” the third encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 4 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Gate: Sepulture (Savage),” the fourth encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 5 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Verse: Fulmination (Savage),” the fifth encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 6 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Verse: Furor (Savage),” the sixth encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Eden 7 Savage

item.title: Eden 9 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Eden’s Promise: Umbra (Savage),” the ninth encounter of the entire Eden raid series. |

item.title: Extreme
item.description: | noun | 1. “Extreme” is one of the commonly used difficulty levels for content, most often associated with Extreme Trials. |

item.title: FFXIV
item.description: Did you know that the critically acclaimed MMORPG Final Fantasy XIV has a free trial, and includes the entirety of A Realm Reborn AND the award-winning Heavensward expansion up to level 60 with no restrictions on playtime? Sign up, and enjoy Eorzea today!

item.title: Health points per second
item.description: | noun | 1. Total healing done divided by the length of the encounter, in seconds. Some players often mistake this for a much more important metric than it is. In reality, high HPS can most easily be achieved by spamming unnecessary heals, which is extremely inefficient and wasteful. Even if you heal efficiently, only doing the bare minimum amount of healing necessary to keep people alive, your HPS will be higherr if your group simply takes more damage, either by failing mechanics, failing to dodge AoEs, or not mitigating attacks properly.

item.title: Heaven On High
item.description: | noun | 1. “Deep Dungeon” content up to level 70. Accessible by level 61 jobs and above. Only has 100 floors, compared to Palace of the Dead’s 200 floors. May also be referred to as “Steep Dungeon,” because instead of delving deeper underground, you are climbing a tower to the heavens. |

item.title: Intelligence
item.description: | noun | 1. The primary attribute, or “main stat,” that is used by caster DPS. |

item.title: Labyrinth Of The Ancients
item.description: | noun | 1. The first 24-man alliance raid in the level 50 Crystal Tower series. |

item.title: Lalafell
item.description: | noun | 1. A pint-sized playable race that’s bursting with personality. Loved for its cuteness, expressive animations, and of course, stature. They come in two flavors: sweet cinnamon roll, and “I am 2'10” of concentrated evil." But they are always smol. So smol. |

item.title: Logs
item.description: | noun | 1. Refers to encounter records from ACT that have been uploaded to FFLogs, which may be used to analyze the events of the encounters or the performance of the players. Often refers to the overview (usually the damage rankings) of a given character’s encounter records across different encounters, e.g. “My logs have been improving with practice.” | | noun | 2. A record of the chat and/or combat log windows.

item.title: Mind
item.description: | noun | 1. The primary attribute, or “main stat,” that is used by healers. |

item.title: Minimum item level, no echo
item.description: | noun | 1. Shorthand for a specific set of options used to scale your equipment down to the minimum item level requirement and disable the “Echo” buff. This is usually done to experience older content at its intended difficulty level at the time of its initial release. |

item.title: Miqo'te
item.description: | noun | 1. A playable cat-person race. They’re like Midlanders, but with cat ears and a tail. And like… twice the animation budget, as far as I can tell… Catgirls, catboys, there’s something for everyone! |

item.title: Omega 1 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Deltascape V1.0 (Savage),” the first encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 10 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Alphascape V2.0 (Savage),” the tenth encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 11 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Alphascape V3.0 (Savage),” the eleventh encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 12 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Alphascape V4.0 (Savage),” the twelfth encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 2 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Deltascape V2.0 (Savage),” the second encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 3 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Deltascape V3.0 (Savage),” the third encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 4 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Deltascape V4.0 (Savage),” the fourth encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 5 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Sigmascape V1.0 (Savage),” the fifth encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 6 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Sigmascape V2.0 (Savage),” the sixth encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 7 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Sigmascape V3.0 (Savage),” the seventh encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 8 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Sigmascape V4.0 (Savage),” the eighth encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Omega 9 Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Omega: Alphascape V1.0 (Savage),” the ninth encounter of the entire Omega raid series. |

item.title: Palace Of The Dead
item.description: | noun | 1. “Deep Dungeon” content up to level 60. Has 200 floors. Accessible by level 1 jobs and above. The minimum requirements are: Disciple of War or Magic level 17 Quest: The House That Death Built Quest pre-requisite: Into a Copper Hell |

item.title: Parse
item.description: | verb | 1. To run a “parser,” or “DPS meter,” which parses combat data to present information in a more readable format, such as displaying DPS, e.g. “Are you parsing?” | | noun | 2. May refer to the log saved by the parser, e.g. “That’s not my parse, officer. I have no idea how it got there, I swear.” |

item.title: Piety
item.description: | noun | 1. The healer-only role substat. Affects how much MP is passively regenerated on every three-second tick. |

item.title: Praetorium
item.description: | noun | 1. A lengthy 8-man dungeon required in A Realm Reborn to progress the Main Scenario Quest. One of the two duties included in the Main Scenario Roulette, often referred to because of its length due to the many unskippable cutscenes, and because of the large experience reward for completing it via the Main Scenario Roulette. |

item.title: Protean
item.description: A small conal AoE on players that shouldn’t be overlapped; the usual resolution of the mechanic is to position players in “clock spots” around the boss. Originally appeared as a mechanic in a3s, where it was a mechanic that was baited by distance from player to boss

item.title: Raid
item.description: | noun | 1. A type of content in which groups of 8, 24, or rarely, up to 48 players challenge a variety of combat encounters. |

item.title: Raid Abbreviation Notation
item.description: | noun | 1. 8-man raids are abbreviated according to the following notation: A letter representing the raid series, followed by a floor/encounter number from the series, followed by ‘S’ or ‘N’ to specify Savage or Normal difficulty. In the first raid series, Coil, the encounters in each of the raid tiers were named “Turn 1, Turn 2, " and so on, so they are abbreviated as T1-T13. The official numbering started over with 1 for each tier, as in “The Second Coil of Bahamut, Turn 1,” but the western community simply continued to count upward from where the previous tier left off.

item.title: Raid Damage Per Second
item.description: | noun | 1. One’s own DPS, plus the DPS they provided to others by providing raid buffs (if applicable), minus DPS they were provided by others' raid buffs. | | noun | 2. Sometimes refers to just the DPS provided by one’s raid buffs, such as an Astrologian’s cards and Divination. |

item.title: Roegadyn
item.description: | noun | 1. A larger playable race characterized by their imposing stature and musculature, and… unique naming conventions. It’s unclear whether male Roegadyn have a cult following among players who appreciate their endearingly goofy mannerisms, or if playing a male Roegadyn is, in itself, the cult. |

item.title: Savage
item.description: | noun | 1. “Savage” is one of the commonly used difficulty levels for raid content, most often associated with Savage Raids. |

item.title: Skill Speed
item.description: | noun | 1. A secondary stat/substat that affects the cast and recast time of weaponskills (generally, GCD actions for Disciples of War), as well as increases the damage of DoT effects and auto-attack damage by a percentage comparable to determination. |

item.title: Spell Speed
item.description: | noun | 1. A secondary stat/substat that affects the cast and recast time of spells (generally, GCD actions for Disciples of Magic), as well as increases the damage of DoT and HoT effects by a percentage comparable to determination. |

item.title: Strength
item.description: | noun | 1. The primary attribute, or “main stat,” that is used by tanks and melee DPS, with the exception of Ninja. |

item.title: Tenacity
item.description: | noun | 1. The tank-only role substat. Modifies all damage dealt and healing done by a smaller percentage than determination, but also slightly reduces all damage taken. |

item.title: The Epic Of Alexander (Ultimate)
item.description: | noun | 1. The level 80 “Ultimate” difficulty raid, based on the Alexander raid series. |

item.title: Turn 1
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Binding Coil of Bahamut Turn 1,” the first encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 10
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Final Coil of Bahamut Turn 1,” the tenth encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 11
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Final Coil of Bahamut Turn 2,” the eleventh encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 12
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Final Coil of Bahamut Turn 3,” the twelfth encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 13
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Final Coil of Bahamut Turn 4,” the 13th encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 2
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Binding Coil of Bahamut Turn 2,” the second encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 3
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Binding Coil of Bahamut Turn 3,” the third encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 4
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Binding Coil of Bahamut Turn 4,” the fourth encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 5
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Binding Coil of Bahamut Turn 5,” the fifth encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 6
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Second Coil of Bahamut Turn 1,” the sixth encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 7
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Second Coil of Bahamut Turn 2,” the seventh encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 8
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Second Coil of Bahamut Turn 3,” the eighth encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Turn 9
item.description: | noun | 1. “The Second Coil of Bahamut Turn 4,” the ninth encounter of the entire Coil/Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Ultimate
item.description: | noun | 1. “Ultimate” is currently the most difficult level for raid content, most often associated with Ultimate raids such as: The Unending Coil of Bahamut (Ultimate) The Minstrel’s Ballad: The Weapon’s Refrain (Ultimate) The Epic of Alexander (Ultimate) |

item.title: Unending Coil Of Bahamut (Ultimate)
item.description: | noun | 1. A level 70 “Ultimate” difficulty raid, based on the Coil of Bahamut raid series. |

item.title: Viera
item.description: | noun | 1. A playable race most recognizable for their long, rabbit-like ears and slender builds. Fans of the series may recognize them from previous titles such as FFXII and the FF Tactics games. Only female Viera were made available in Shadowbringers, but male Viera will be made available with the release of Endwalker. |

item.title: Vitality
item.description: | noun | 1. The primary attribute that that affects maximum HP for all jobs. |

item.title: Weapon Damage
item.description: | noun | 1. The single most potent stat on any of your equipment: the damage listed on your weapon. Has a larger effect on your damage dealt and healing done than anything else, including main stat upgrades. Thus, your weapon is almost always the most effective piece of equipment to upgrade. Usually referred to as “weapon damage,” though technically, it’s listed as “Magic Damage” on the weapons of casters and healers.

item.title: Weapon's Refrain (Ultimate)
item.description: | noun | 1. A level 70 “Ultimate” difficulty raid, based on Ultima Weapon. |

item.title: Wipe
item.description: | noun | 1. Used as either a noun or a verb to describe the death of the an entire party, or of all participants in an encounter. |

item.title: World Of Darkness
item.description: | noun | 1. The third 24-man alliance raid in the level 50 Crystal Tower series. |
